pages.text: Asparagus is an herbaceous, perennial plant growing to 100â€“150 centimetres tall, with stout stems with much-branched, feathery foliage.
The shoots are prepared and served in a number of ways, typically as an appetizer or vegetable side dish.
Though there are only a few commonly used species, there are many cultivars and methods of preparing chili peppers that have different names for culinary use.
Many fresh chilies such as poblano have a tough outer skin that does not break down on cooking. Chilies are sometimes used whole or in large slices, by roasting, or other means.
The stems are usually crawling on the ground and form adventitious roots at the nodes. The leaves are screwed along the stems.
Globally, sweet potatoes are now a staple ingredient of modern sushi cuisine, specifically used in maki rolls.
The peanut is an annual herbaceous plant growing 30 to 50 cm tall. Peanut fruits develop underground. Peanuts grow best in light, sandy loam soil
Dry-roasting peanuts is a common form of preparation. Dry peanuts can be roasted in the shell or shelled in a home oven if spread out one layer deep in a pan and baked.
